decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to establish control over the game using Faeries creatures and disruption spells. By utilizing cards like Spellstutter Sprite and Mistbind Clique to counter spells and disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also using cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize to dismantle their hand. In addition, the inclusion of powerful control spells like Cryptic Command and removal spells like Dismember and Doom Blade helps to maintain control of the board. Overall, this deck focuses on disruption and control to outmaneuver the opponent and secure victory.

The focus of this deck is to aggressively control the board with cheap removal spells and countermagic while continuously applying pressure to the opponent with efficient creatures that can attack early and often. By combining versatile threats like Young Pyromancer, Delver of Secrets, and Geist of Saint Traft with powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero before they can stabilize. The inclusion of Snapcaster Mage provides additional flexibility and value by allowing the player to reuse key spells from their graveyard.

This aggro deck focuses on fast, aggressive creatures like Geist of Saint Traft, Ghor-Clan Rampager, and Tarmogoyf, supported by efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing for explosive starts and a proactive game plan. The inclusion of Snapcaster Mage adds versatility and value to the deck, while Noble Hierarch and Wild Nacatl provide additional aggression and mana ramp. The deck aims to pressure opponents early and maintain tempo throughout the game to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on using a combination of efficient creatures and disruption spells to apply constant pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. The deck's strong removal suite allows for the ability to handle a variety of threats, while cards like Tarmogoyf and Liliana of the Veil provide consistent value and momentum. By deploying threats early and disrupting the opponent's hand, this aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently to secure victory in a fast-paced Modern 1 vs 1 matchup.

The main idea of this Modern Merfolk deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of sea creature minions, buffing them up with Lords of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident. Master of Waves provides extra creature tokens, while Merrow Reejerey helps to control the board and tap down opposing creatures. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Cursecatcher and Path to Exile, as well as mana fixing with Spreading Seas. Aether Vial helps to cheat creatures into play and provide a steady stream of threats.

The main focus of this Modern Aggro-Affinity deck is to quickly swarm the board with low-cost artifacts and use cards like Arcbound Ravager and Cranial Plating to boost their power and attack quickly. By leveraging cards such as Steel Overseer and Master of Etherium, the deck can overwhelm opponents with a quick and aggressive strategy. The inclusion of lands like Inkmoth Nexus and Blinkmoth Nexus also allows for additional evasive threats to be presented, putting pressure on opponents and forcing them to respond quickly or risk being overwhelmed. The deck aims for a fast and explosive win through utilizing artifacts and synergistic cards to overpower opponents.

This deck aims to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Utopia Sprawl and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx, while also utilizing Arbor Elf and Garruk Wildspeaker for additional ramp. The goal is to cast Genesis Wave, which allows the player to put a number of permanents from the top of their library onto the battlefield equal to the amount of mana spent. This can lead to explosive plays by putting powerful creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth and Terastodon into play, allowing for a game-winning swing. The deck also includes cards like Eternal Witness and Primal Command for recursion and utility.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using Amulet of Vigor, Simic Growth Chamber, and bounce lands to drop big threats like Primeval Titan early on. It utilizes card draw and tutors to find key pieces of the combo, while also disrupting the opponent with Pact of Negation. The goal is to swarm the board with powerful creatures and overwhelm the opponent in a single explosive turn. With the ability to generate a massive amount of mana and play multiple spells in a turn, the deck aims to consistently pull off its combo and win the game swiftly.

This Jund Aggro deck is focused on fast and efficient creature and hand disruption, with a mix of hard removal and burn to control the board. The deck features powerful and versatile creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant, supported by cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Liliana of the Veil provides additional disruption and discard, while Raging Ravine and Treetop Village offer aggressive threats. With a solid mana base and a mix of removal and disruption spells, this deck aims to pressure the opponent and control the game.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponent's strategies through taxing their resources and hindering their mana base while deploying aggressive creatures to quickly close out the game. By utilizing cards like Thalia, Leonin Arbiter, and Aven Mindcensor, the deck aims to slow down opponents' plays and disrupt their search effects, while also generating additional value with creatures like Blade Splicer and Restoration Angel. The deck's synergy with Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment and enables unexpected plays, ultimately overwhelming opponents with a combination of disruption and aggression.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively apply pressure on the opponent with low-cost, efficient creatures and burn spells. By using fast creatures like Ash Zealot and Rakdos Cackler, along with powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Searing Blaze, this deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently to win the game before the opponent can fully set up their own strategy. Additionally, cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Shrine of Burning Rage further punish the opponent for playing spells, adding even more pressure to the board.

The deck focuses on assembling the Twin combo by using either Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite to create infinite creature tokens with Splinter Twin, or by using Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker to copy either of the aforementioned creatures. It also includes control elements like Remand, Cryptic Command, and Snapcaster Mage to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to quickly set up the combo while maintaining a level of interaction and protection through spells like Lightning Bolt and Spellskite. With a mix of combo pieces and control spells, it seeks to outmaneuver opponents and win the game through a sudden burst of damage.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Tower, Power Plant) to generate massive amounts of mana early in the game. This mana is then used to cast powerful threats like Karn Liberated, Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, and Wurmcoil Engine. The deck also includes plenty of artifact mana sources and card draw/filtering spells to ensure consistency in finding the pieces needed to set up the Tron lands. Additionally, there are ways to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Oblivion Stone and Relic of Progenitus.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through removal spells and counterspells while using powerful midrange creatures like Geist of Saint Traft, Restoration Angel, and Snapcaster Mage to apply pressure and win the game. The deck aims to maintain board presence with Celestial Colonnade and burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lightning Helix to finish off the opponent. By establishing a strong defense and offense, this UWx Midrange Control deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a 1 vs 1 Modern format.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, drawing cards, and stalling the game until it can assemble the combo of Scapeshift and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal lethal damage to the opponent. The deck runs a suite of cantrips and card selection spells to help find key pieces of the combo, while also running removal and counter spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It aims to ramp up mana quickly with ramp spells like Sakura-Tribe Elder and Search for Tomorrow, allowing it to reach the critical mass of lands needed to execute the combo efficiently.

The main concept of this deck is to flood the board with aggressive Merfolk creatures, while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Cursecatcher and Spellstutter Sprite. The Merfolk lords, Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident, buff all other Merfolk on the battlefield, while cards like Spreading Seas and Path to Exile help control the opponent's board. Aether Vial allows for cheating creatures into play at instant speed, and Thassa, God of the Sea provides card selection and unblockable for key creatures. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive creatures and disruptive spells.
